meanings.sent1: She overurged him to eat all his vegetables, even though he was full.
meanings.sent2: The coach overurged the team to give their best effort in the game.
meanings.sent3: He overurged his friend to watch the movie, but she fell asleep halfway through.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's constant overurging felt like a never-ending push towards success.
meanings.sent5: The overurge to check her phone every minute was hard to resist.

meanings.definition: To push or force someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The bully overurged the smaller kids to give him their lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind overurged the door open, causing it to slam shut.
meanings.sent3: His overurging to finish the project quickly led to many mistakes.
meanings.sent4: The overurge to conform to society's expectations can be overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: The overurge to impress his boss made him work late into the night.

meanings.sent1: She overurged her friend to join her for the dance class.
meanings.sent2: The speaker overurged the audience to take action against climate change.
meanings.sent3: His overurge to try the new restaurant paid off with a delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: The overurge to explore new opportunities led her to travel the world.
meanings.sent5: The overurge to succeed in his career motivated him to work hard every day.
